DD_Attribute.name: local_mean_solar_time_sol
DD_Attribute.definition: The local_mean_solar_time_sol element specifies the number of solar days elapsed since a reference day (e.g. the day on which a landing vehicle set down) for local mean solar time (LMST). Days are measured in rotations of the planet in question from midnight to midnight. The reference day is '0', as Landing day is Sol 0. If before Landing day, then value will be less than or equal to '0'and can be negative.
DD_Attribute.comment: Definition was adapted from PDS3 PSDD definition for msl:local_true_solar_time_sol and needs to be verified. -- EDR

DD_Attribute.name: local_true_solar_time_sol
DD_Attribute.definition: The local_true_solar_time_sol element specifies the number of solar days elapsed since a reference day (e.g. the day on which a landing vehicle set down) for local true solar time (LTST). Days are measured in rotations of the planet in question from midnight to midnight. The reference day is '0', as Landing day is Sol 0. If before Landing day, then value will be less than or equal to '0'and can be negative.
DD_Attribute.comment: Definition taken from PDS3 PSDD (msl:local_true_solar_time_sol) and may need updating. (Particularly need to verify reference day.) -- EDR

DD_Attribute.name: mission_phase_name
DD_Attribute.definition: The mission_phase_name identifies a time period within the mission.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: The ATLO mission phase (Assembly, Test, and Launch Operations) is the time of spacecraft and instrument assembly and test. During this phase data products are generated using flight hardware. They are usually not part of the final PDS archive but may be used for testing and peer review.

The cruise mission phase is from the time of escape from Earth's orbit through the time of entry into Mars' orbit. Some data products may be generated during this time, including instrument checkout data.

The development mission phase refers to the period of data processing software development and testing, before instruments are integrated with the spacecraft. Data products generated during this phase are usually not part of the final PDS archive but may be used for testing and peer review.
The surface mission phase is the time from arrival at Mars through the end of surface operations, including the primary mission and any extended missions that may take place.

The test mission phase is not a time period but a placeholder for the mission_phase_name value, used for data products generating during all project tests such as ORTs, SVTs and thread tests. Data products generated in this way are usually not part of the final PDS archive but may be used for testing and peer review.

DD_Attribute.name: observation_id
DD_Attribute.definition: The observation_id uniquely identifies an Insight science observation.

DD_Attribute.name: product_type
DD_Attribute.definition: The product_type identifies a group of data products within a collection that have some property in common, such as processing level, resolution, or instrument-specific setting.

DD_Attribute.name: release_number
DD_Attribute.definition: Release_number is the number of a scheduled release of InSight data from PDS. The first Insight data release is Release 1. The release_number for a given product is always the first release in which it appears, and does not change if the product is revised later.

DD_Attribute.name: sequence_id
DD_Attribute.definition: The sequence_id identifies the Insight planning sequence associated with a science product.

DD_Attribute.name: sequence_version_id
DD_Attribute.definition: The sequence_version_id identifies the version of an Insight planning sequence associated with a science product.

DD_Attribute.name: software_name
DD_Attribute.definition: Software_name identifies the processing software used to generate a data product.

DD_Attribute.name: software_version_id
DD_Attribute.definition: Software_version_id identifies the version of the processing software used to generate a data product.

DD_Attribute.name: sol_number
DD_Attribute.definition: Sol_number is the number of the Mars day on which an observation was acquired. Landing day is Sol 0.

DD_Attribute.name: spacecraft_clock_count_partition
DD_Attribute.definition: The spacecraft_clock_count_partition provides the clock partition active for the spacecraft_clock_start_count and spacecraft_clock_stop_count attributes.
DD_Attribute.comment: Definition taken from PDS3 dictionary; may need updating. -- EDR

DD_Attribute.name: spacecraft_clock_start_count
DD_Attribute.definition: The spacecraft_clock_start_count is the value of the spacecraft clock at the beginning of an observation.
DD_Attribute.comment: Formation rule needs to be verified for InSight. --SS

DD_Value_Domain.formation_rule: Value should be of the form: 1/nnnnnnnnn.mmm

DD_Attribute.name: spacecraft_clock_stop_count
DD_Attribute.definition: The spacecraft_clock_stop_count is the value of the spacecraft clock at the end of an observation.
DD_Attribute.comment: Formation rule needs to be verified for InSight. --SS

DD_Value_Domain.formation_rule: Value should be of the form: 1/nnnnnnnnn.mmm

DD_Attribute.name: start_local_mean_solar_time
DD_Attribute.definition: Start_local_mean_solar_time is the local mean solar time, as defined in the main PDS4 data dictionary, at the beginning of an observation.

DD_Attribute.name: start_local_true_solar_time
DD_Attribute.definition: Start_local_true_solar_time is the local true solar time, as defined in the main PDS4 data dictionary, at the beginning of an observation.

DD_Attribute.name: start_sol_number
DD_Attribute.definition: Start_sol_number is the number of the Mars day on which a multiple-day observation was begun. Landing day is Sol 0.
DD_Attribute.comment: Start/stop_sol_number are provided as an alternative to sol_number for observations that cross one or more sol boundaries.

DD_Attribute.name: start_solar_longitude
DD_Attribute.definition: Start_solar_longitude is the solar longitude, as defined in the main PDS4 data dictionary, at the beginning of an observation.

DD_Attribute.name: stop_local_mean_solar_time
DD_Attribute.definition: Stop_local_mean_solar_time is the local mean solar time, as defined in the main PDS4 data dictionary, at the end of an observation.

DD_Attribute.name: stop_local_true_solar_time
DD_Attribute.definition: Stop_local_true_solar_time is the local true solar time, as defined in the main PDS4 data dictionary, at the end of an observation.

DD_Attribute.name: stop_sol_number
DD_Attribute.definition: Stop_sol_number is the number of the Mars day on which a multiple-day observation was ended. Landing day is Sol 0.
DD_Attribute.comment: Start/stop_sol_number are provided as an alternative to sol_number for observations that cross one or more sol boundaries.

DD_Attribute.name: stop_solar_longitude
DD_Attribute.definition: Stop_solar_longitude is the solar longitude, as defined in the main PDS4 data dictionary, at the end of an observation.

DD_Attribute.name: channel_name
DD_Attribute.definition: The SEED data products for the SEIS instrument contain data from a single instrument channel. The channel_name identifies which SEIS channel data are included in the SEED file.
DD_Attribute.comment: The enumeration values and meaning can be revised. --EG

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: The SP 1 channel records data from the first axis of the SP seismometer.
The SP 2 channel records data from the first axis of the SP seismometer.
The SP 3 channel records data from the first axis of the SP seismometer.
The VBB 1 position channel records position data from the first axis of the VBB seismometer.
The VBB 1 temperature channel records temperature data from the first axis of the VBB seismometer.
The VBB 1 velocity channel records velocity data from the first axis of the VBB seismometer.
The VBB 2 position channel records position data from the second axis of the VBB seismometer.
The VBB 2 temperature channel records temperature data from the second axis of the VBB seismometer.
The VBB 2 velocity channel records velocity data from the second axis of the VBB seismometer.
The VBB 3 position channel records position data from the third axis of the VBB seismometer.
The VBB 3 temperature channel records temperature data from the third axis of the VBB seismometer.
The VBB 3 velocity channel records velocity data from the third axis of the VBB seismometer.

DD_Attribute.name: instrument_clock_start_count
DD_Attribute.definition: The instrument_clock_start_count is the value of the instrument clock at the beginning of an observation.

DD_Attribute.name: measurement_duration
DD_Attribute.definition: Measurement_duration indicates the length of time covered by a given measurement.

DD_Attribute.name: measurement_type
DD_Attribute.definition: Measurement_type indicates the seismometer (VBB or SP) and whether the data were collected in continuous or event mode used in a measurement.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: Event mode data from the SP seismometer.
Continuous mode data from the VBB seismometer.
Event mode data from the VBB seismometer.

DD_Attribute.name: sampling_rate
DD_Attribute.definition: Sampling_rate specifics the rate (samples/time) that data from an instrument were sampled and recorded.

DD_Class.name: Observation_Information
DD_Class.definition: The Observation_Information class provides information about a science observation.

DD_Class.name: SEIS_Instrument_Parameters
DD_Class.definition: Attributes specific to the InSight Seismometer data products
